sidebar.q1Description: All statements validated with scientific references

export.csvComingSoon: CSV export functionality will be implemented with papaparse

about.title: About the Author
about.subtitle: Creator and Developer
about.name: Demetrios Agourakis
about.credentials: Chemical Engineer | Lawyer | MSc Student in Regenerative Medicine and Biomaterials (PUC-SP) | Medical Student
about.bio: Demetrios Agourakis is the creator of Darwin MFC, a free academic platform dedicated to Family and Community Medicine. With a unique interdisciplinary background â€” chemical engineer, lawyer, master's student in Regenerative Medicine and Biomaterials at PUC-SP, and medical student with internship at Faculdade SÃ£o Leopoldo Mandic â€” I developed this guide to support professionals and students with practical, evidence-based tools.
about.motivation: To facilitate daily primary care consultations, promoting comprehensive, effective, and accessible clinical practice for all. The platform offers over 198 mapped clinical conditions, interactive protocols, clinical calculators, and an updated medication database, integrating perspectives from tissue engineering, biomaterials, and primary health care.
about.projectNote: This is an independent open-source project. Contributions welcome!

credentialsList.title: Academic Background
items: MSc Student in Regenerative Medicine and Biomaterials (PUC-SP)
Medical Student (Internship: Faculdade SÃ£o Leopoldo Mandic)

contribute.title: Contribute to the Project
contribute.subtitle: Darwin MFC is an open-source project. Your contribution can help healthcare professionals worldwide.
contribute.translation_desc: Help translate the platform to new languages or improve existing translations.
contribute.content_desc: Contribute protocols, literature reviews, and content validation.
contribute.code_desc: Contribute code, bug fixes, or new features.
contribute.feedback_desc: Report bugs, suggest improvements, or share your experience.
contribute.github_desc: All source code is available on GitHub. Issues, PRs, and discussions welcome!

free_forever.title: 100% Free, Forever
free_forever.description: Darwin MFC is a non-profit academic platform. All content is and always will be completely free. No subscriptions, no premium features, no ads.

auth.username_hint: 3+ characters, letters, numbers, and underscores only

errors.username_invalid: Username can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
errors.password_min_length: Password must be at least 8 characters

community.title: Community
community.subtitle: Connect, learn, and share with healthcare professionals worldwide
community.forums_desc: Join clinical discussions and get peer advice

cases.title: Clinical Cases
cases.subtitle: Share and discuss anonymized patient presentations
cases.step1_desc: Provide anonymized patient demographics and case type
cases.step2_desc: Describe the clinical presentation (all PII will be detected)
cases.step3_desc: Verify anonymization and submit for peer review
cases.placeholder_presentation: Describe the patient's main complaints and presentation...
cases.placeholder_history: Past medical history, medications, social history...
cases.pii_warning_desc: The following may contain patient-identifiable information. Please remove or anonymize:
cases.anonymization_passed_desc: No identifiable information detected. Case will undergo peer review before publication.
cases.anonymization_failed_desc: Please fix {count} potential PII issues before submitting.
cases.preview_hidden: Click 'Show Preview' to see the anonymized version
cases.review_notice: All cases undergo peer review before publication to ensure complete anonymization and clinical accuracy.
cases.error_generic: Failed to submit case. Please try again.

community.cases_desc: Share and learn from anonymized patient cases

mentorship.title: Mentorship Program
mentorship.subtitle: Connect with experienced practitioners for guidance
mentorship.step1_desc: Tell us what you're looking for in a mentor
mentorship.step3_desc: Introduce yourself and explain what you hope to learn
mentorship.placeholder_message: Introduce yourself, explain your learning goals, and what you hope to gain from mentorship...
mentorship.no_mentors_found_desc: Try adjusting your filters to see more results.
mentorship.response_time_notice: Mentors typically respond within 3-7 days. Be patient and check back for updates.
mentorship.request_sent_desc: Your mentorship request has been sent to {mentor}. You'll be notified when they respond.
mentorship.error_missing_fields: Please select a mentor and write an introduction message
mentorship.error_generic: Failed to send request. Please try again.

community.mentorship_desc: Find mentors or become one for fellow practitioners

reply.error_too_short: Reply must be at least 10 characters

B.label: Moderate
B.description: Lower-quality RCTs or well-designed observational studies

C.label: Weak
C.description: Observational studies, case series, or expert consensus

D.label: Expert
D.description: Expert opinion or clinical experience without strong evidence

GPP.label: Good Practice
GPP.description: Good practice point based on clinical experience of the guideline group

highYield.highYieldDescription: Show only key points, red flags, and critical values

ai.title: Darwin AI
ai.subtitle: Clinical Assistant
ai.welcomeDescription: I can help with questions about diseases, medications, protocols, and more. Coming soon!
ai.disclaimer: This is a scaffold. Real AI coming soon.
ai.comingSoonResponse: Darwin AI is under development! Soon I'll be able to help with clinical questions, search the database, and provide evidence-based answers with citations.

prompts.differential_diagnosis: What are the differential diagnoses for these symptoms?
prompts.red_flags: What are the red flags I should watch for?
prompts.dosage_adjustment: How should I adjust the dose for renal impairment?
prompts.drug_interactions: What are the main drug interactions?
prompts.when_to_refer: When should I refer to a specialist?
prompts.follow_up: What is the recommended follow-up schedule?
prompts.explain_mechanism: Explain the pathophysiology in simple terms
prompts.clinical_pearls: What are the key clinical pearls?
prompts.evidence_level: What is the evidence level for this recommendation?

hero.title: Darwin MFC
hero.subtitle: Complete Family and Community Medicine guide for point-of-care consultation in Primary Care

stats.diseasesDesc: Conditions mapped with ICD-10, ICPC-2 and international ontologies
stats.medicationsDesc: RENAME 2024 with interactions, adjustments and pharmacogenetics

quickAccess.title: Quick Access
quickAccess.quickConsultDesc: Direct access at point of care

doencas.title: Primary Care Diseases
doencas.subtitle: {count} clinical conditions with ICPC-2 and ICD-10 codes
doencas.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, ICPC-2 or ICD-10...

medicamentos.title: Primary Care Formulary
medicamentos.subtitle: Essential medications for Primary Health Care
medicamentos.description: with dosing, interactions, renal adjustment, and pregnancy safety. Based on RENAME 2024 and ANVISA labels.
medicamentos.searchPlaceholder: Search by generic name, brand name or indication...

protocolos.title: Clinical Protocols
protocolos.subtitle: {count} interactive flowcharts for clinical decision-making in Primary Care
protocolos.searchPlaceholder: Search protocols by name, category or tags...
protocolos.results: {count, plural, =0 {No protocols found} =1 {1 protocol found} other {# protocols found}}
protocolos.tryOtherTerms: Try searching with other terms or clear the filters

howToUse.title: How to use protocols
howToUse.step1: Click on a protocol to open the interactive flowchart
howToUse.step2: Navigate through nodes by clicking on the presented options
howToUse.step3: Use zoom and pan to explore complex flowcharts
howToUse.step4: At the end, copy the recommendation to paste in the medical record

calculadoras.title: Clinical Calculators
calculadoras.subtitle: Risk Assessment and Clinical Decision Tools for Primary Care

warning.title: Important Notice:
warning.text1: These calculators are educational and clinical decision support tools.
warning.text2: They do not replace complete medical evaluation and clinical judgment.
warning.text3: All formulas include references to validated original sources (Q1 standard).

emptyState.fillAndCalculate: Fill in the fields and calculate

imc.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
imc.description: Nutritional status assessment based on weight and height.

ckdepi.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (CKD-EPI 2021)
ckdepi.description: Renal function estimate. 2021 equation without race variable.

cockcroft.title: Creatinine Clearance (Cockcroft-Gault)
cockcroft.description: For medication dose adjustment. Uses actual body weight.

phq9.title: PHQ-9 (Depression)
phq9.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by:
phq9.q1: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
phq9.q3: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
phq9.q4: Feeling tired or having little energy
phq9.q6: Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure
phq9.q8: Moving or speaking slowly or being fidgety/restless
phq9.q9: Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself

phq2.title: PHQ-2 (Quick Screening)
phq2.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by:

auditc.title: AUDIT-C (Alcohol Use)
auditc.q1: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
auditc.q2: How many drinks do you have on a typical day?
auditc.q3: How often do you have 5 or more drinks on one occasion?

cage.title: CAGE (Alcoholism)
cage.cutDown: ut down - Have you ever felt you should cut down on your drinking?
cage.annoyed: nnoyed - Have people annoyed you by criticizing your drinking?
cage.guilty: uilty - Have you ever felt guilty about your drinking?
cage.eyeOpener: ye-opener - Have you ever had a drink first thing in the morning?

findrisc.title: FINDRISC (T2DM Risk)
findrisc.description: Prediction of type 2 diabetes risk in 10 years.

dengue.title: Dengue Hydration
dengue.description: Hydration volume calculation according to risk classification.
dengue.groupBDesc: No warning signs, with comorbidity or social risk
dengue.groupCDesc: WITH warning signs (abdominal pain, vomiting, bleeding)

apgar.title: APGAR Score
apgar.description: Newborn assessment at 1st and 5th minute of life.

gail.title: Gail Model
gail.firstBirthAge: Age at first birth (0 if nulliparous)

clinicalCases.title: Interactive Clinical Cases
clinicalCases.subtitle: Learn from real Primary Care cases

instructions.title: How to use
instructions.exportDesc: Save as image or JSON file

genogram.title: About Genogram
genogram.description: A genogram is a graphical representation of family structure that goes beyond a traditional family tree.
genogram.reference: Reference: McGoldrick M, Gerson R. Genograms in Family Assessment.

ecomap.title: About Ecomap
ecomap.description: An ecomap represents the family connections with external systems and community resources.

clinicalTip.title: Clinical Tip
clinicalTip.text: Use genogram and ecomap as dialogue tools with the family, building them together during consultation to promote reflection and engagement.

instructions.addPerson: Click on the canvas to add a person
instructions.selectSecond: Click on the second person to create the relationship

emptyState.title: Start your Genogram
emptyState.description: Click on "+ Person" in the toolbar and then click on the canvas to add family members

alerts.exportImageError: To export as image, use Print Screen or screenshot tool.
alerts.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear the genogram?

instructions.dragAndEdit: Drag resources to reposition them. Double-click to edit.

emptyState.description: Click on "Add Resource" to get started

alerts.exportImageError: To export as image, use Print Screen or screenshot tool.
alerts.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear the ecomap?

calcTab.title: Clinical Calculators
calcTab.description: BMI, GFR, CV Risk, and more
